meanings.definition: To give birth to a child.
meanings.sent1: She was childing a baby boy last night.
meanings.sent2: The mother was childing a new life into the world.
meanings.sent3: The stork joked that it was childing a special delivery.
meanings.sent4: The garden was childing flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The tree seemed to be childing leaves overnight.

meanings.definition: To act or behave like a child.
meanings.sent1: He was childing by throwing a tantrum.
meanings.sent2: The adult was childing by playing with toys.
meanings.sent3: The CEO childing during the team meeting brought laughter.
meanings.sent4: The wind was childing by blowing playfully through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The cat was childing by chasing its tail in circles.
